page.title: 08EDUCATION IN NORWICH
page.content: { In Norwich there are three stages of school life.Children begin their{FIRST {SCHOOL}at the age of five and finish when they are eight.These schools have up to 200 children in them.Between the ages of eight and twelve children attend{MIDDLE SCHOOLS}which have up to 400 children in. Finally there are {HIGH SCHOOLS}which are large comprehensive schools, where children stay until they are least 16.The largest High School is the Hewett School which has over 1800 pupils, whilst the smallest is Bowthorpe School with 880 pupils. Before children go to the High Schools, their parents look around the different schools and choose which one is the most suitable for their child. In Norwich,there are{26 FIRST,18 {MIDDLE and 7 HIGH SCHOOLS.
